test.utterance: Four fighter jets fly in close formation, it looks light a tough and dangerous maneuver! I am impressed!
Jagged rocks rise up from this coast, and pebbles make a rough carpet down to the water, making this beach look inhospitable, empty, forsaken.
The child looks horrified, wide eyed, teeth bared, clinging to the adult. It makes me afraid to imagine what is happening here.
This rollercoaster loops all over, high above the ground, the picture makes me feel the adrenaline and the rush of wind as the car whizzes along the track.
Carnival rides whirl through the air! Lights fill up the night! It is a fun, exciting environment and brings back memories!
This ride car has just plunged down the water fall! I can well remember going on rides like this, feeling the thrill of dropping down the hill and the spray of water on my face.
These people are on a thrilling ride, dangling high up in the air. I can practically feel the adrenaline!
I like the contrast of a flower, shriveled and dying, while one in the background bursts into brilliant yellow blooms. It is the circle of life and a gentle reminder of nature's rhythms.
This person screams, their hands are like claws on their knees, their eyes dark and narrowed, they are the picture of anger and it is all directed right at the camera.
This woman's eyes are huge, her lip downturned and stuck out. Her chin looks like it is quivering, as if she is about to cry, and I feel sad looking at her.
This looks like a line for a waterslide or other theme park ride high up in the air! We can't see where it leads, but I can feel the excitement and anticipation of the crowd!
I love the way the colors of the rides whirl through the night sky! I can practically hear the noise of the carnival and feel the rush of excitement
I love the solitude off this grey expanse of water. No boats ride these waves. The grey sky looms heavily, close over the dark water. It looks quiet, a contemplative sort of scene.
This is a sweet intimate moment, a couple, eyes close, kissing each other on the cheek, it's a fleeting, happy moment caught on film.
This is a lovely flower, a little past its prime. Its simple leaves still cling to a pastel pink. It still looks pretty, with a sort of quiet, peaceful sort of dignity as it fades.
Bright rides splash colored lights into a black sky! I love the carnival atmosphere, the color, the motion, of this image. It really captures the fun feeling of being at a carnival.
Crowds of people roam the night heading for the rides at this fair. I can feel their excitement, smell the enticing scent of kettle corn, hear the music and noise of the fair.
I hate the way the spider's legs splay outward, like it's ready to leap! I know how fast those monsters can move, and just seeing those eight spindly legs gives me the shivers!
The olympic torch is passed along as people watch from the sidelines. What a unique and special moment!
I can feel the rush of being on a big rollercoaster, right at the top of a hill about to make the plunge!
These gravestones were made with care, the elegant script and careful carving speak of someone close left behind who cared very deeply.
This is a dramatic portrait. The woman stares out from the darkness intently with one heavily lined eye, the rest of her face shadowed, capturing the viewers attention, drawing you irresistibly in.
The landscape behind this woman is stunning, beautiful blue waves and yellow sand. It looks like a perfect day for a swim.

This woman looks solemnly off to the side, frowning, eyes intent, as if something heavy weighs on her mind. The black and white photo lends the scene a somber feel, as if something grave has happened here.
Two friends beam with excitement in this rollercoaster! They grip the handles, probably feeling the thrill of the speed. What a wonderfully familiar feelinng!
This woman smiles happily, sitting casually on this dock like she's having a lovely day at the shore. She's the picture of relaxed happiness.
The nearly shattered glass looks like the result of violence, the red splatter reminiscent of blood. I am afraid to think about what happened here.

Two people enjoy a quiet sunset beside a lake. The water is calm, the sun perfectly shaded by clouds, its gold streaming out across the sky. It is a lovely scene and speaks of serenity, comfort, and companionship.
Two men fight fiercely in a taekwondo match, their blows meeting in the air, I can feel the thrill of the fight, the excitement of watching for the win!
This bright, smiling clown is reminiscent of fun times, like carnivals and fairs. The big, purple hair is absurd, as is the blue bonnet. The whole picture speaks of bizarre amusement!
This rugged landscape stretches out towards remote mountains. No humans stand in these jagged rocky crevices and stones. It speaks to the sprawling power of the Earth outside of human reach.
A woman enjoys a beautiful, sunny day outside. I can practically feel the warm sun through the straw hat and the relief of shade on my face.
I just want to bury my finger in this cat's luxurious fur and scratch behind her perky ears.
Rollercoasters like these bring back memories of the thrill and fear and fun summer days!
This rustic scene of an old man with a bowl of peeled potatoes inside a rough, wooden structure evokes a sense of simplicity and calm.
The poison bottle labelled anger states ironically I'm not angry! It is a sad contradiction, a message of suppressed frustration, bottled up rage which ferments into poison.
This dog is flopped comfortably on a plush doggy bed, looking perfectly content and relaxed, perhaps only minutes away from a nap!
The girl smiles, looking up from her dinner at the photo-taker; she gives us a small glimpse at a contented family meal.
The woman scowls at the man, perhaps a butcher, cutting up some meat. She frowns, arms crossed, staring him down as if waiting to make a complaint. She oozes irritation, impatience, and anger.

The woman's eyebrows knit together in a scowl, her mouth is downturned deepening the lines on her face. Her collarbone stands out as she hunches. Her tension oozes out of the picture, clearly telegraphing how upset she is.

This bland platitude about happiness encourages selflessness, giving everything to others as if you do not matter. The contrast with the peaceful image of birds and umbrellas lifted up on the wind only serves to accentuate the emptiness of the quote.

There is something lonely about this one old man standing alone in an empty train station, perhaps one that hasn't been used in a long time. The picture is dark and dusty, as if the place and maybe the man himself have been long out of use and forgotten.
This lion gnaws on a fresh kill, looking exactly like the king of the jungle. He closes his eyes, licking his lips contentedly, just absolutely secure in his position at the top of the food chain.
It is a quiet day at a fair or amusement park, the child sized cars sitting empty and quiet. It is a restful image, a calm pause between moments ofexcitement.
This looks like a healthy smoothie! The frothy, bright green looks like it could be kale or celery or something else wholesome. I feel like it'd be a nice drink for some quick, healthy energy.
This man is not happy to be photographed. He holds a fist up, scowling out at the viewer, clearly interrupted in his work. His anger just roils out of this scene!
A man skateboards through the street, I can practically feel the rush of speed and the thrum of adrenaline.
This little motorcycle looks like fun! The rider leans as if taking a curve at full speed, I bet it's a real thrill!
I can feel the excitement, the rush of being mid leap, like the man in this image! His motion radiates energy and enthusiasm!
This looks like a quaint old corner, with a single fire hydrant standing out stark against worn, mossy concrete and stone buildings. It looks like a quiet, appealing little corner.
This looks like a nice restaurant; it's clearly a popular place, as there are many people here. It reminds me of many good times going out to eat with friends.
This dog is adorable! He looks into the camera with such expressive eyes as he stands over a bright orange ball, like he's ready to go play.
This kid is having so much fun on his skateboard! This reminds me of fun summer days, and I can practically feel the rush of adrenaline!
This person looks ready to kick off a skateboard trick, or perhaps they have just finished. I can practically feel the adrenaline rush, the excitement of it the ride.
This looks like a truck on the way to or from a summer cottage, piled high with a boat and outdoor chairs. It makes me think of summers out by a lake, relaxing and enjoying nature.
This is a nice motorcycle! Shiny, clearly well taken care of, it's decked out in studded leather side bags and seats, I'd love to see it racing down a highway.
This looks like a regular evening at the movies. The man talking on his phone, waiting by the door, is very mundane. There's nothing to indicate anything more exciting or weird is going on here.

This woman looks like a tourist, camera raised, ready to capture some new scene even in the pouring rain! Her backpack and full shopping bags put me in mind of a chaotic trip, needing to capture the sights and get all the souvenirs no matter the weather.
This iced bundt cake looks absolutely delicious; I love the way the icing drips down over the chocolate and pools on the plate, drawing up memories so vivid I can practically taste them.
This image captures the eye with the way the light surrounds the tulips like an aura. It gives the flowers an otherworldly feeling. It's a very impressive, artistic image.

These birds dart through the sky like a blur! It is unclear if they are fighting, mating, or just flying, but their energy comes through the picture with their darting wings, stark black under the bright clouds.
This looks like a news van setting up for some major event on a bright summer's day. It makes me excited to know what's going on here.

This looks like some kind of memorial, though it is not clear what it is for. The dark shapes coming out of the metal relief look like soldiers, the dark imagery contrasting sharply with the bright day and only serving to enhance the melancholy feel.
This looks like a fun scooter ride in the midst of a parade on a sunny day. It looks like an exciting day out.
This looks like a fun photo booth event on a sunny, summer day. It puts me in mind of summer family outings and funny candid snapshots.
This kid looks funny with his blue hair. It even matches his blue toothpaste! He looks like a fun, unique kid.
This looks like a simple family moment, the old man shucking corn perhaps getting ready to sell it at this stall, the children looking on. Despite the activity, it's a quiet moment.

I love the way the headlights blur in this extended exposure image. The street looks empty, the sky dark, as if it is just a quiet night at this intersection. But then we see the long rows of light, evidence of cars gone by, just a hint of the action this place has seen.
This is a quiet street, a solitary woman walking down the sidewalk. It is a calm image, a familiar, everyday sort of snapshot.
These chefs look like they are relaxing outside during a well deserved break. They lounge, still in uniform, one with a cigarette and coffee. They look tired, but not unhappy.

This looks like the aftermath of a bad car accident. Several people push, trying to right the vehicle, while firefighters mill around. It makes me afraid to think that somebody could be hurt or killed in such a collision.

This scene of two children having a day in the woods is a very pleasant image. I love the greenery and the fallen leaves of autumn and remember many cool fall days when I explored parks and green spaces as a child.
I feel a sense of a quiet, everyday life. People walk past shops and stands, just going about their business. It is a very normal, familiar sort of scene.
There is something peaceful about these people fishing on the calm water. I love how they float slowly on simple, handmade rafts, no engines in sight.
This is a casual snapshot of people walking on a street, some admiring the view, nothing too exciting happening. It exudes a feel of normalcy and contentment.
The grey sky speaks of an impending storm. The crowds of cars and people look like they will soon be caught in a downpour.
I love the woman's big smile and the way the man looks at her, his arms around her waist, as if she is the most important thing in this moment.

exp.utterance: These two girls smile playfully, getting close as if they are very comfortable with each other and very happy to be together. It is a nice image.
A ride soars high into the sky! I can feel the adrenaline and the thrill of the amusement park on a beautiful sunny day.

This sketchbook shows detailed human faces, each expression easily identifiable and extreme. The pencil drawings are simple, but I feel awe at the artist's ability to show anger and fear, disgust and shock so saliently on the page.
This girl looks sad, her eyes downcast, mouth unsmiling. Her eyebrows wrinkle, her hair hides half her face. It makes me wonder what has made her feel this way.
This pious inscription is carved in stone, speaking of great devotion and a place of solemn significance.

This grey monochrome image is stunning, the lines of the hand so stark against the skin, the compass carefully crafted. The play of light behind the hand is striking. It is a very well composed image, and I am impressed.
This is a great view of carnival grounds, probably early in the day before the crowds arrive. It has an exciting feel off anticipation, like the quiet before the storm.
This reminds me of the old arcades, with the dim light and bright machines, I can practically hear the sounds of game play and young people having a blast.
I love the bright purple, yellow, blue carnival ride! Its happy colors stands out starkly agains the night sky in a blur of movement.

Two men look closely at the front tire of one van outside a shop, as if something is wrong with the car. I can practically feel the frustration and discomfort as the bright sun beats down and they try to figure out what is wrong.

Seeing the bull taunted by the matador makes me angry. It is just an animal forced into a game by people, pointlessly chasing after the red cloth. It puts me in mind of animal abuse and callous disregard for their welfare.

I can feel the adrenaline, the feeling of inertia, the speed as this motorcycle rider pulls up their bike in a trick! He pulls his bike into a dangerous angle, nearly upright, making himself actually airborne. It looks thrilling.
I like the rolling green landscape behind this rocky hill and the group of people. It looks like a lovely view on a bright sunny day.
The text here is very angry, all about blame and hoping for somebody else's pain. It's very mean-spirited and vindictive.
The way these rocks jut sharply out of the sea is majestic, almost as if they could touch the sky just like the birds. It is a gorgeous, awe inspiring natural scene.
This woman sits alone with a box of takeout, eyes downcast, giving off an air of sadness and loneliness. It's like she doesn't have anyone to share a meal with.

This scary clownish display makes me laugh! I love the twisted makeup and tuft of blue hair on the one, and the bulging eyes on the other! It reminds me of Halloween, a fun holiday for playing with scary imagery!

This cop looks like he's on his way to break up a protest or something. He's all geared up, face covered, leaning on his motorcycle, surrounded by other police vehicles. Just seeing it makes me aggravated.
This is a lovely, rustic looking clock with a design of simple pantry staples it looks like it'd be a nice and subtle addition to a homey kitchen.
This rollercoaster has just crested a hill, high up in the sky, I can feel the mixed rush of fear and joy looking down on the coming drop!

A well managed and very green water side property. While it is pretty, I am angered by what could have been in this location naturally if it had not been torn down to make way for a lawn.
Sounds like someone is trying to compensate for their bad personality. I am disgusted at the thought of having to speak to someone with this mindset.

A picture of a child glamour shot. Not only am I disgusted by the idea of children, but also by the fact that this girl's mother is probably out there trying to enter her daughter into beauty pageants.

The beach looks extremely crowded and dirty. I assume the water is full of sunblock residue. It's disgusting.
It's an old crummy bus from Asia. The green and white colors bother me because they don't really match.
It is a bathroom in a cheap hotel. It doesn't even have shower curtains. It's disgusting.
There is a guy having fun by himself with a kite and his friend did not even bother to show up. That angers me.
It's so cluttered. The piano should not be there. It bothers me that the colors of the sofas do not match.
He or she looks like an annoying liberal who can't stop eating and then complains about fat shaming. People like that angers me.
I'm afraid of heights but the lack of stability of that chairlift is scary. Those two look very afraid.
Somehow, the green cones bother and anger me. I'm used to seeing orange cones. Besides, the picture is blurry and this annoys me as well.
I feel sad. It is a beautiful picture of a very nice boat but the water looks dirty and the sky is cloudy. Besides, I'm pretty sure it is smells bad over there.
Those mattresses are really weird and the room, in general, looks very dirty.
The surfer look funny, at least the way he is standing in the surfboard is very funny.
This looks like a crummy hospital without sanitation. There are seven people and they all seem incapable of dealing with the patient.
She is checking the current state of an old house. She probably went to see her old parents.
It bothers me that the cars ruined the potential symmetry of the picture. I'm pretty sure they took another one later.
Beautiful picture. A random boat in an immense body of water. It's like a scene from the Lord of the Rings.
The bird is fine but it is standing on a rusty metal piece. It makes me think this picture was taken in a bad area of town.
I am pretty sure there are bugs in those plants. When people take pictures of gardens that close, it usually looks disgusting.
Ok, this looks weird and inappropriate. Maybe I'm being paranoid but it looks like they all finished having sexual intercourse and now, they are cleaning up.
Based on the current events, I imagine those people belong to a terrorist organization from Africa, at least based on the way they carry those sticks.
Those brown doors remind me a government building. I hate it.
I'm happy because he brought his dog with him on a fishing trip.
Even though it is rainy, there are people gathering for something patriotic. It make me feel content.
I'm pretty sure that girl is happy but her facial features make her look sad. She actually makes me feel sad.
There is a lot going on in this picture. I hate yellow motorcycles and there seems to be a big crowd. It's annoying.
I don't like the color of the stones and the murky water. That fountain needs some cleaning.

That water doesn't look clean. If I were there, I would be smelling sewage, fish and diesel from the train. Also, that fact that two boats are there willing to spend time in that narrow river, means there is nothing else going on in that town.
That looks like a dangerous sport. It scares me to think how people are willing to risk their life like that.
I don't like this coffee shop. There are no comfortable places to sit down with your laptop. I mostly hate the ceiling; it's full of cables and random stuff.
The tower looks imposing from this angle, and the surrounding buildings look pretty. Less people in the picture would be great though.
Those pictures above the urinals are funny but it's really exciting to know there are still places that haven't been absorbed by the PC culture.
A storm seems to be coming and this guy decided to ski anyways. He also seems to be floating. The picture is sketchy and scary.
This picture portrays how dangerous the ocean can be. There are people looking at the sea as if somebody was about to drawn.
No matter that the current trend is, I still fully trust police and security personnel, especially in big and dangerous cities like Boston. I feel awe.
The old bus and those run down buildings make me think I'm in a foreign country as a tourist. I specially like the plants and cleanliness.
The picture had potential but it ended up looking dull. The statue is hard to see and it looks like a ghost.
That sandwich looks delicious and I would love to eat it. It is aesthetically pleasing and everything looks clean.
This guy looks funny. I don't know if he's playing for real or just doing silly dances.
Somebody is about to buy a new Apple product. It's exciting. Well, he is probably just looking but still, he or she is interested in Apple products and that is exciting.
It amuses me because this guy looks determined to throw that frisbee perfectly. Somehow, I feel he would fail miserably.
I always respected the military. Awe is the closest feeling but I have to say the picture doesn't do any good. Those soldiers look uncoordinated.
He has crazy eyes and is doing a weird pose with a doughnut. It's scary.
It seems that that picture was taken in an old decadent ex soviet country. It looks sad.
This guy looks drunk and now he's eating a pizza which he would most likely throw up. This idea makes me feel amusement.
I know it looks bad but, I have a cat and I love seeing cats having fun, even though they are the biggest danger to local fauna. It's amusing for me.
There is a sexual connotation here. I like how she poses with a toothbrush. She has a cute face.
The STOP sign is destroying the harmony of the picture. Besides, they used flash so the sign looks brighter. It's annoying.
It's a really crowded place and everyone is taking pictures instead of enjoying whatever is going on there.
Even though I hate crowded places, this picture looks pleasant to me. There are so many umbrellas with nice colors. The bus is interesting.
The huge tree and the shadow it projects makes me feel insecure, as if I was in a horror movie.
The pole in the middle annoys me. It destroys the harmony of the picture.
It's a boring cake with no decoration. I'm pretty sure somebody paid a lot for that horrible cake.
It bothers me that I can't see faces in this picture. Besides, it is raining and there is no point in playing frisbee with that weather.
That guy looks sad and poor. I feel sorry for him.
He broke his skateboard. I don't know if he gets hurt after the picture was taken but it looks scary.
I love cats but this kitten looks disgusting, honestly.
I admire when people try to help elephants. That baby elephant seems to be very comfortable around that man.
It looks like the guy in the picture is training motorcycle gang members. It's scary.
Those umbrellas annoy me. They are all blueish. There is no order in this picture.
These people are just abusing the dogs by forcing them to surf. Horrible people. It's annoying.
That girl is cute and seems to like having a little fun from time to time. I love it.
I like cats but the picture is so blurry that it annoys me. Why can't people learn to take pictures?
Those bushes bother me a lot. They make the house look untidy.
There seems to be trash in the ground and three doesn't allow me to see the rest of the animals.
The picture had potential but the flash from the truck ruined it.
It looks like this picture was taking at a funeral. Those two candles look depressing and the whole picture, in fact, gives me a funeral vibe.
The area looks polluted and still, we see people paying for this boat trip. It's disgusting.

exp.utterance: It is disgusting because I'm sure there are feces all over the place. Also, so many plants don't allow me to see the giraffes properly.
It is a pleasant picture of a suburban home. It doesn't look expensive but it most likely belongs to a nice family. I feel contentment.
Those two kids are having fun but the area doesn't look safe. It's scary to think something bad might happen to them.
A careless person took this picture and it is annoying. Besides, the giraffe looks aggressive.
I don't like his clothing and the walls behind him. He is probably a drug dealer.

I don't know him but he is a symbol of the new PC trend in the world. The destruction of Western civilization. It is unnecessary to force his ideology by wearing a Mickey mouse shirt and hipster glasses.
Somehow, I feel disgusted because the elephant face does not look symmetrical. It might be sick.
It amuses me how a person can invest so much money in a small plane knowing that he or she will fly it seldomly.
I hate protestors. Even though they fight for a noble cause, protests have become a stage to display the ugly side of humanity. It angers me.
The mountains look imposing and this guy looks fearless. I like his red jacket too.
It could've been more symmetrical but the photographer messed it up. I also don't like the old sign in the back.
Somebody decided to make fun of this guy because he's awkward and took a picture of him. That's bad.
It is a funny monkey doll that reminds me of babies. The plastic ring makes noises and I like that.
I'm happy to see a girl trying to learn skateboarding.
I don't like how this picture was taken. It's dull and it bothers me that the road is not even painted. I also hate the grey cars.
It disgusts me to think this photo was taken in a polluted area. The river looks muddy and polluted.
The weather looks bad in this picture and the beach is empty. If she's there despite the bad weather, it means trouble.
It is a nice day. People are going to work. Streets are clean. It reminds me of my college days. I feel content.
The picture looks pretty but I don't like the mix of colors, especially pink and yellow. I like minimalistic environments.
The picture looks dull. It's cloudy and the big building in the back looks like a prison.

test.utterance: This fire hydrant looks like it has been neglacted.  It needs a paint job and could use a flush to make sure it works.
I don't know how well you can play a game on a Wii from the couch, but this guy is giving it a go.  It looks like he is having fun doing it.
It is hard to trust strangers.  This train stations looks like there are some people in it, that are questionable.
This senior picture is black and white.  This young man looks so serious.
This elderly man is buying bananas at a farmers market.  He looks sad and lonely.  His poor body looks broke down.
This harbor looks overcrowded with boats trying to unload.  Some boats look like they are homes to these people.
Is this picture of a dog and his owner at this crosswalk here because he was hit by a car here?  This area looks so dark and sad.
This looks like fun.  Opening and setting up a new Wii with games.  I like the Wii sports DVD.
The owner of this cow is trying to coax him out of the water.  He might be stuck in the mud.  That is never good.
Wow!  This snowboard competition must be hard.  This person is really up in the sky.
Please donate to this organization.  They urgently need to to transport blood using the motorbike.  What a great cause in a time of need!
I would think this is awfully dangerous to be playing with fireworks or some kind of fire, with so many people around.  This could hurt someone in the group, or hurt a lot of them.
This black stallion has so much power.  You can see the determination in this horses eyes to compete.
The tourist on this sight seeing bus are looking to the left at what is being shown to them.  It has caught everyones attention.
This butcher shop has a wide variety of meats, including these sausages.  This inspector is looking them over to make sure they are packaged correctly.
The woman works for the fire department.  I have to wonder if she is relaying some bad news about a fire to a family member.
I love to hear people playing music.  The accordion is an amazing instrument that you don't see very often and makes fantastic harmony.
Wow, this hunk of a young man is waving at the crowd.  He has a very nice midsection.  And he is super handsome.
New construction on bridges it what this country needs right now.  These guys are conversing on the next phase of the project.
It is amazing that this would keep a hot air balloon in the air.  The woman looks like she is holding down the rope while the owner is filling the balloon.
Wow, to ride a wave like that is awesome.  She has such balance and confidence.
This is tug of war.  It looks like these two are related and are having fun with this toy.  I bet the toy loses.
The construction workers are getting ready for their day at work.  They are getting the cones out and reading their orders.
I don't think I would enjoy a shirtless, tattooed window washer - if I were looking out of my window.  That is just gross.

This little guy is getting his car ready for the Pine Wood Derby for Scouts.  I bet he is hoping for the fastest car and first place.  Looks like he is putting the final sanding on his car before paint.
I have to wonder if these three men are stealing fuel, with this pump they have attached to the top of the barrel.  They have a wrench to open the spout.
This little baby girl is just crying up a storm.  I hope she does not have colic.  She is beautiful.
These men look like they are running for their lives.  Why is there so much violence in our world?  This makes God sad.
This person is wiping the steam off a mirror and leaving their finger marks behind.  That always shows.
This camper is cooking a pizza on a grill at the campsite.  This looks really good.
This young man looks like he is in a doctor's office.  He must be feeling bad or awaiting a diagnosis.
This man looks like he is angry with something that he is watching on TV.  I like his snacks.
Why are these people sitting or standing and working on their computers?  Couldn't some kind of desk or check be provided in this area?
This TV looks old and there are Christmas lights still hanging.  There appears to be trash by the front door too.
These Blue Angels are flying over a water tank in a small town.  They are flying in unison as practiced.
This street party has drawn quite the crowd.  The streets look well lite and it looks like it is safe.
These surf boarders are riding some really rough waves.  This looks very dangerous.
I don't know what goes on in Sturgis, probably the same type of stuff that goes on in Vegas.  There are entirely too many people here at this time of year.
These people are waiting for the sign to let them know that they can cross the street.  It appears they are in Japan or another Asian country.
These Asian women seem to be in their phones, looking at different things.  Maybe they are on a shopping trip and waiting for a bus.
Are these two zebra's mating?  They are really pretty animals.
I think this is the outside of a police station or a prison.  Maybe even a federal court.  I would hate to have my words recorded, but I am glad this sign is up so that you know it.
Riding on the world's fastest train makes me scared to get on it.
I would be afraid to let this little boy have this knife.  I wonder what he is making with this food chopper.
This is a beautiful sunset that these airplane passengers are seeing as they are taking off from the airport.
Milk and cereal for breakfast are not enough for a young person, before they head out to school.  They need something to hold them over until lunch and this just doesn't do it.
Touring an historic castle in another county, and it looks very interesting.
This little boy is playing in the water with his rain boots on, while dad is filming him.  Rain has caused flooded the marina.
On this rainy day, you can see the reflection of the couple, in the puddle below the steps.
My grandkids would call this cow, a milk cow, since it is white.  If it were brown, it would be a chocolate milk cow.
The skateboarder makes this sport look so easy, but I would be afraid to take my feet off the board.
This land looks so desolate and baron.  A couple of cows looks like all this farmer can afford.
This is such a tiny kitchen or washroom.  It looks so old and out of date.
I think this is a wedding and there is a horse and carriage ride for them once they come out of the church.  This looks like fun.
This stem of flowers has come from someone's flower garden.  It probably smells so good.  And I think the grower is so happy to have such a harvest from their flowers.
These people look like they are getting ready for a business trip with their travel bags.  They appear to be walking in an airport.
This looks like a high school reunion and they people are getting to know each other again after being out of school for 50 years.

exp.utterance: This zookeeper is checking on the health of this toddler elephant.  They seem to be bonding very well.
Is this guy late for work?  What could be in the backpack?  There appears to be spray paint on the front of the building, is this a bad part of town?
This is an awful dark street for a cyclist to be on.  I would not want to be on this street.
This older gentleman is catching a few winks on his trip via train.  He must not sleep well or is on a long journey.
This room seems so dark and imposing.  The guy seems to be monitoring something or trying to hack someone's computer.
This guitarist loves his instrument and loves his church, but the looks of the guitar.
This little guy is so unhappy about his experience at the park.  Did he fall off something or is he lost.  Or did he want to ride what his sister is on?
The city is checking the fire hydrant to make sure it is operating properly in this neighborhood.
I would be so afraid that I would get water in my home, being this close to the channel.
It takes coordination to lift this bike this high.  This rider must really enjoy riding near the water side.
This guy is amazing with his skills on the water.  And the backdrop is beautiful.  He would be fun to watch.
These two pups are teasing each other with a bone.  They are the same size, so don't know who will be the winner in this draw.
I bet these motorcycles are riding together, maybe taking a little drive through the hills and mountains.
This church fellowship looks like it has a good turnout for the carry in.
This recipe looks disgusting.  I don't think I could eat a whole fish prepared like that.  The chef has all the ingredients on the table and is working on the fish.
This small regional airport helps get people from one select destination to another.  It is not too busy.
This looks like a hard sport, with having to keep your balance and concentrate on staying upright.  Skiing competitively would be hard and this woman looks like she is taking a warm up lap.
This photographer looks lost and forlorn.  Is the weather causing issues with him taking pictures?
I think this guy is calling into work to tell him that he missed his ride to work.  I hope he does not get fired.
I think these two have had a great day snowboarding and are coming back for some hot chocolate at the lodge.

test.utterance: There is a look of panic and the woman in the foreground looks like she is urgently trying to save someone's life - almost like she needs to shock someone back to life. But she looks inept and the clown in the background with the smile on his face doesn't comfort me - it looks like he doesn't care what's going on. I've been in life and death situations anymore and that look of panic is awful.

Lazy, summer day by the beach. These three people are perfectly positioned to take in the waves as they come crashing to the shore. But mostly I imagine they are good friends hanging out and relaxing without the worries of real life.
A senior citizen pushing a wheelchair. She is alone. She is surrounded by throngs of people - none of whom seem to notice her or care. Very lonely.

I am sure this catch represents some livelihood for the man holding this enormous (sword?) fish from the deck of his workboat. And I am sure he worked hard for it. But it's still a man holding a dead creature. That's hard to look at.

This worker is doing his job but nothing about it looks fun. He looks hot and sweaty and dirty. And from the way he is standing - it seems like he has been there a while. This is routine - but what a lousy routine. Plus he in the middle of the street with dirty cones. Just yuck.

Something about the angle of the photo make it looks like the boat is about to tip over - it leans too much. And, while the man doesn't look remotely worried or concerned, he also doesn't seem perched securely where he is standing.

The looks on these girls faces is a mixture of fatigue and resignation. They don't seem like there is anyone around keeping an eye on them. It looks like they are waiting for something that is not going to materialize or has gone wrong. It also is sad that I can't help but worry about the little girl in the green/white skirt and who might be trying to look up the skirt from across the way.

I love the blase expressions on both of the little girls' faces. And the way the girl in the front is gripping the handlebar and wears a black shirt and shorts makes me think of a biker chick...only juvenile. Extremely juvenile. And the shape of the buggy is pretty funny too.

I despise seeing an animal (the cattle) being chased and trying to be lassoed. The fear that the animal must be experiencing is cruel. The two men so tall in their saddles look like gigantic jerks - proud of their "manliness". They are in control - of the horses they ride and the animal they hunt. Hate this.

Seeing this one student standing and clearly presenting thoughts to the others as they stare at him is anxiety producing. It reminds me of high school days when you had to do oral reports. Even the way the boy (green pants) is standing shows a tentativeness - he is leaning back from them, not towards them. He looks uncomfortable - just like I would be.

Too many people in too small an area. The turnout is impressive but it makes me feel like it would be hard to breathe. It also looks less like a "walk" and more like a party in the park. And...no masks.

At first, this photo frightened me - thinking the man in the foreground looked dangerous and angry. But once I saw the painting in the background of George Burns and the sign above his head about the parking - I thought it was funny. And that the scary man has his hand up with a cigarette and Burns has his hand up with his cigar...kind of perfect.
I just feel like screaming "get out of my way, people!". Not enough space. Too many people. Not much wiggle room to maneuver around everyone. Irritating.

It's a pretty, scenic background with the green pond but the man has his arms folded and his face has an expression of irritation and displeasure. Almost like he is angry at the person taking the photo. Seems like a jerk.

The picture looks dated but reminds me of a retirement lunch for a co-worker. None of the people look like they really belong together and yet...they are. The body language is closed off (girl in black with arms folded, man in suit can't wait for it to be over). It looks obligatory. And we have all been there.
Fancy man in a fancy looking establishment at the bar... I bet he is waiting for his blind date from the way he is dressed to impress and searching curiously down the bar.

The people look dirty. Nothing attractive about the woman grasping the open bottle of booze. I'm sure many are drunk. Then there's the matter of the guy in the middle with the white cowboy hat wearing overalls and possibly nothing else.

Big, dirty, metal machinery. Street workers in the background having to do laborious, messy work. They are obviously kicking up debris. Terrible to have to work at night. Who knows if they are going to accidentally hit a pipe or cause an outage. Yet all I really think of - is the traffic jam it causes for people trying to get somewhere but the lanes are closed and the sinus infections from all the junk released into the air. Ugh.

The man in the foreground is looking down, looking pensive and sad. I imagine he has shared a painful story with the other gentleman whose face shows concern and rapt attention. But the man with the coffee cup...he looks sad.
It's such an embarrassingly small turnout for these men in uniform. No excitement from the watchers. Not much of a parade. You just feel sorry for them.

This looks like a little boy staring off at a large group of people having fun by a bonfire. But for some reason, it doesn't feel like he was included. So he is stuck watching the others having fun. Sad.
I can't tell what this man is reaching his fingers into but it looks electrical and I see cords. And when I see that, I think he is going to get electrocuted. Stop!
One man maneuvering a small dinghy on choppy water...takes serious muscle strength. Impressive. And cold. But he looks like he is managing it without too much effort.

All that food, no sneeze guards and many people hovering over/around it spewing germs. It looks like it's probably some kind of work conference lunch break with colleagues chatting with each other - but when they are doing it over the food, it just screams of food poisoning. Yuck.

Something uneasy about this. The guards around the car make it look like a checkpoint of some kind possibly at a border of some place in Europe. Then there is the sweet elderly man on his bicycle that looks like it is headed towards the car and I don't want any collision to occur.

A concrete hole and a machine in a residential neighborhood...all I can think of is the noise and irritation of being awakened by the workers. Plus, it looks like it might be sewage related - so that can't smell good.
It looks like a really beautiful space in nature being destroyed by a bulldozer. I like the rocks mixed with the grass and the stream...and then this big metal monster has to wreck it.
She is so hungry that she didn't even want to spend time taking her jacket off. And it looks like her eyes are closed - so I am thinking she might be a little drunk.

The stances of both the man in the foreground and the woman in the background look like they are poised to attack (the way they hold their racquets doesn't help). They look like they are yelling and getting irriated with the woman sitting on the grass. They look unnecessarily hostile and mean.

This is a street sign I have never seen before. I love it. But...I think it invites the opposite of what the sign says. I think you want to pass just to see what happens. Is Hogwarts somewhere down the road - or is that Gandolf? Funny.

The animal is beautiful but the way the image is shot with the angle of the animals head tilted up and a person's hand holding it up from the neck, makes me think the poor creature is about to be slaughtered. There's even a part of me that thinks the life is actually trickling out of the animal's eyes.

I'm not sure what the guy in foreground is holding but it looks nasty - as does the expression on his face. He looks miserable. The guys in the background all look equally unhappy - and they all seem to be carrying some kind of trash. I can only imagine the smell.
This looks fun. Guitar singer at the microphone - clearly up on a stage. Imagining an outdoor concert in the park somewhere with a big crowd listening to the music. The singer is cute too!

So lovely to see the blue ocean water and the spacing of the 4 horses with people on their backs...nice balance. They look like seekers. Curious about where it is and how the horses came to be there that day. Very serene.
So funny how the red and white in the pole is positioned perfectly in the center of the dog's black-and-white eyes. His black eye looks closed - kind of like he's winking at us.

The couple is riveted to what they are looking at and the way they are off in the corner with their heads angled in towards each other makes it all seem very secretive - like spies at work. Plus they dressed so different - she is casual  and he is in a suit.
Two men and both of them look like slobs. Guy in blue shirt needs to lose that Santa beard. Guy in black...a mohawk? Really?

I hate this woman with the glasses. She looks nasty and she has her hand around the neck of someone that looks like her daughter - and that's not motherly love. And the young girl looks like she is smiling through the pain of faking a moment. The mom looks like a control freak. Very rigid.

The man in black and white clothes with his hands on his hips has a posture/pose that screams "I am a tourist and can't figure out where the heck I am!". Also it looks like he might have been super-imposed into the shot. The way he is right in the between the woman with yellow bag  and the cluster of girls but none of them seem aware of his presence.

The bare woods with all those rocks look dangerous. Like maybe there could be hunters around. But both mother and son are walking downhill...and it looks a bit steep. Slipping could be easy and the young boy has no shirt on. No protection if he does fall. Wicked sunburn if he doesn't.

That ash-filled cigarette stub in her fingers, the way she is leaning over and nastily addressing whoever she is with, the heavy black eye-liner...so much to be grossed out by. Too much jewelry and sparkle. Cleavage is fine but not when you're wearing a sneer on your face.

This is just an ugly view. Too many horizontal lines (power lines, red ramp, the floors of the building in the background). No character to the environment. And the guy in the yellow neon looks like he might be a worker assessing the whole site.
The smaller dog might be little, but he is angry, those fangs are nasty and it's eyes look demonic.

This is obviously some type of Jewish religious gathering (from the yarmulkes on the men's heads) but the man at the microphone looks like he is trying to do his thing and all the men in the background are either not interested or possibly mocking him (the bearded guy with the sunglasses has that mocking smirk on his face). Show some respect people.

The way his hat is angled on his head is such that it is leaning down towards the sunglasses. And the way the sunglasses are being propped up is such that they are leaning up towards the hat. A funny visual. This guy has got some wicked balancing skills that he can carry them all and they aren't falling off. His expression is smug.

The way this little bird is just sitting there and minding its own business but taking it all in.  It's nice. It looks fragile being small and perched on a branch, but at the same time, kind of powerful because it seems all-knowing. Wish we knew what was going on in its head.
I love the dog lunging at the frisbee and the guy doing a major gymnastic pose as he leans/falls backward. That's impressive. But I don't think he intended to do that...and that makes it funny.

The moody lighting on the subway train makes me think it's night or going through a tunnel. With so few people on the train and the man in the background on right - I worry for the woman in the foreground. It's just got that vibe that says a crime could happen soon.

This makes me think of Children of the Corn. I don't like hesitant look and stance of the man in the middle of these weeds or dried up corn stalks. And it looks like there is a crow or something that he is observing. Crows are nasty. This feels like it's about to become to a horror movie.

There's just so much hilariously wrong here. The ensemble...the shoes, the long shorts on the short body - and then that out of place Yankees hat. But the expression of boredom/irritation as he rests his face in his palm...priceless.

It's an interesting photo stylistically. But my attention is drawn to the older man in the foreground who is looking straight down towards his feet like he has no hope and no one in his life - especially when the background has a family of some kind all conversing together.

This looks like some kind of craft service situation. The two people seated look fairly uncomfortable in little plastic chairs. The giant bottles of condiments on a cheap table. The trash can. Ugh...it just looks cold, uncomfortable, dirty and artery clogging.

That takes courage and an immense amount of confidence and skill. In this case, it doesn't even look like his body is near his bicycle. Wondering if he is midway through a turn or if something has gone wrong and he is coming down for a hard fall. Still impressive.

Cause is admirable...but I think it's for breast cancer from the pink shirts. So many people walking for a cure...but it feels like this has been going on for a long time and still no cure. Reminds me of the people I have lost to cancer and that makes me sad.

There's an awkwardness to this gathering. The man in red looks bored silly. The woman in black looks like she is putting on appearances and smiling for the camera. The woman in red looks like she is judging the other woman for trying to "on". And they are all dressed in such matching colors.
This little boy and his big saucer-shaped brown eyes. You can lose yourself in that gaze. I love his fancy outfit too. And his hint of shyness.

The man in his purple shirt has a goofy, ho-hum expression on his face. Like he is winging this whole "construction" thing.  It doesn't inspire confidence that he should be working with power tools. He seems more like the type that has been working for 10 minutes but is already ready to call it a day.

Something about her attitude as she is walking with her designer handbag and her hand stretched out like she is laying down the law to the person on the other end of the phone just is really unappealing. Not to mention the neon colors in the shirt.
Very sweet. A new daddy kissing his newborn child - trying to soothe his/her tears. And it's a big kiss he is planting.

I love young girls doing school presentations. The girl in white has a t-shirt that is so innocent and sweet with the animated cats and her lace skirt. That shows her youth. But I imagine she is also a little nervous from the way she is clutching her paper notes.

The girl wearing #35 is posed in a way that makes her look like she is trying to unobtrusively pull her underwear out of her backside while pretending to be really engrossed in the other girls that are high-fiving.

I can't quite tell what's happening but the man in the foreground walking towards the camera is carrying a gun, there is an ambulance type of vehicle in the center and people climbing on a truck in the background. It looks like scary chaos.

exp.utterance: When you think of the leg strength it must take for this guy to ride his red bicycle uphill on mountainous terrain...that's impressive. Nothing I could ever achieve. I hope there isn't a steep fall waiting for him as he goes over the top of this hill.

All the tall beautiful trees and the one lone bench that I suspect people go to when they have decisions to make. It reminds of the Robert Frost poem "The Road Not Taken". Good place to get grounded and sort things out and make choices.
It's something about the open-mouth, dumb-founded expression on this guy's face with the TRUTH sign behind him. Like whatever is coming out of his mouth is anything but the truth.

I'm not sure if that's a field of wheat or dry, dead weeds - but it looks barren and depressing and like a fire hazard. And also, it makes me think about how awful my allergies would be after a little while in all that "nature". Bleak.
It's too large a crowd with too many cars on the street that don't seem like they can move quickly. It makes me think that something bad is about to happen. They all look so unsuspecting.

The expression on the woman's face looks confrontational. Whatever that is that she is swinging around in the black/white sleeves looks like it would hurt if it made bodily contact with another person.

There's a whole lot of fashion missteps going on here. My first thought is that this is some kind of costume. Those colors do not match! But judging from the amount of clothes that are strewn about, she is midway through trying to find the right thing to wear... I identify with that clutter. And the foot sticking up is pretty funny.

This is such a strange photo to have a soft filter on. I feel like that is used to make it more romantic or pretty. This woman is all dressed in black and is biting her lip. You just can't romanticize it.

That rock looks mighty steep - like it would require special gear to scale the side of it. Yet the tiny man seen here looks like he is just in blue jeans and a button down shirt - not prepared at all. And possibly on the verge of losing his footing as he is looking down. Very scary.

This could just be a picture of someone about to throw a frisbee, but in the image, it looks like an angry man violently hurling something. The way his arm is raised looks aggressive. The rocks around him add to the tension of the photo.

The cigarette smoking men all over the place. The sad looking animals standing around (possibly getting ready to be taken to slaughter) and in the center, is this little boy whose expression is pure misery. He should be laughing and playing and he looks miserable.

I know this is an action shot, but the look on the man's face seems nervous and apprehensive. It looks like he is trying to get a shot in but it's one that is trying to protect himself more than he is attacking his sparring partner. He looks like the underdog that is about to get pummeled and he knows it.

Ugh, the sea of humanity at the airport. No face with a smile. No one making eye contact. Just busy, busy, busy, hustle, hustle, hustle. Nothing exciting to look at - although the blue-suited woman walking through is with a red-shirted man on the other side is interesting.

Such a beautiful dog. I love the nobility in the way he is sitting and staring to the side. And I love how the coloring of the objects behind him compliment his coloring (especially the dog's eye color). The blue sky is a terrific accent to the whole image.
Elbow to elbow is how crowded this room is. It's so full and the ceiling is low and the brown walls make it look like the room is narrowing in on them. Definitely not for the claustrophobic.
While the image is pretty and the lush greenery is great, these guys look too close to the edge of what would be a fatal fall. I am concerned about the dog who looks like it wants to try exploring.

She is oblivious to where she is walking, what is around her...just has her face glued to her mobile screen. What an idiot. And she has a self-important air about her. Don't be so full of yourself, lady.
Something about places of worship makes me nervous immediately. But then you add people in matching outfits dancing outside it and I start to think cult. It just creeps me out.
I love a daddy/daughter moment and it's sweet that she is sitting on his lap and he has his arm around her tummy while they look at the menu (my guess).

Something about the guy with his phone to his ear and the way he is looking makes me think he is one of those people that carries on really loud conversations on his cell phone, completely oblivious to the people around him that have to HEAR HIM. So self-centered. And that self-important look on his face... Go. Away.
